author: Kitty Greenwald
title: Simple, Spicy Chicken à la Diable From the Chefs at Frenchette
text:
THERE’S A WHOLE genre of dishes ideally suited to these brisk, bright pre-springtime days. Take this chicken à la diable recipe from Lee Hanson and Riad Nasr, two chefs who have defined French cooking in Manhattan for two-plus decades. “The English have the deviled preparation. The Italians have the diavolo. And this is the French version,” said Mr. Nasr. “You have these spicy, bold flavors in every culture, but this is a bit more elegant.”
The dish draws its wonderful warming quality from mustard, chile flakes, garlic,... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
